snippet: New York City and the National Park Service will work together to improve access and plan restoration projects for more than 10,000 acres of parkland.
abstract: New York City and the National Park Service formalize a partnership to jointly manage more than 10,000 acres of parkland in and around Jamaica Bay; joint venture will improve access, foster research, run education and recreation programs and plan restoration projects for the bay, an important estuary and migratory stopover for hundreds of species of birds.
lead_paragraph: New York City and the National Park Service will work together to improve access and plan restoration projects for more than 10,000 acres of parkland.

headline.seo: City and Federal Officials to Manage Jamaica Bay
headline.main: City and Federal Officials Will Jointly Manage Jamaica Bay
headline.print_headline: City and Federal Officials Join to Manage Jamaica Bay
